channel.title: [Azure] Start-up error
channel.description:
[Fri 06/17/2011]: Launched server. Starting Azure on FridderScape.no-ip.biz/my.ip.goes.here:43595... Loading packets... Loaded 43 packets. Loading item definitions... Loading 11791 item definitions. Loading equipment definitions... Loaded 1012 equipment definitions Loading npc definitions... Loaded 5 npc definitions. Loading npc spawns... Loaded 5 npc spawns Loading shops... Loaded 1 shop definitions. Loading teleports... Loaded 9 teleport definitions Loading dialogues... Loaded 9 dialogue definitions. Loading options... Loaded 2 chat option definitions. java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address: bind at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Source) at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source) at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source) at com.rs2.Server.startup(Server.java:133) at com.rs2.Server.run(Server.java:110) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue . . .
How can I make it work? Not the best networking coder... I portforwarded port 43595 and fridderscape.no-ip.biz is mine.

item.title: [Azure] Start-up error
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

`SJ_:

It can’t bind to the port you’re trying to use???

I think he was just creating the InetAddress improperly. Although, witching JDK versions, and working is a bit strange…

item.title: [Azure] Start-up error
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Creating an InetAddress that way is unnecessary.

InetSocketAddress address = new InetSocketAddress(port);
// ...
channel = ServerSocketChannel.open();
channel.socket().bind(address);

That’s how I do it at least.

Read full topic

item.title: [Azure] Start-up error
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

…Nevermind. Found my error and fixed it. My JDK is fucked up and only allows a certain way to be ran… hard to explain but I fixed it. Thanks for the help Vain.

Read full topic

item.title: [Azure] Start-up error
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

What is the ‘host’ and ‘port’ set to in the Server class?

It’s set so it’s read in the run.bat file.

@echo off
@title [%date%] RuneScape
@echo [%date%]: Launched server.
java -cp ./bin/;./libs/xpp3_min-1.1.4c.jar;./libs/xstream-1.3.1.jar com.rs2.Server fridderscape.no-ip.biz 43595 600
pause

Read full topic

item.title: [Azure] Start-up error
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Line 133:

	private void startup() throws IOException {
		// Initialize the networking objects.
		selector = Selector.open();
		serverChannel = ServerSocketChannel.open();

		// ... and configure them!
		serverChannel.configureBlocking(false);
		serverChannel.socket().bind(address); //<-- Line 133
		serverChannel.register(selector, SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT);

		// Finally, initialize whatever else we need.
		cycleTimer = new Misc.Stopwatch();
		playerMap = new HashMap<SelectionKey, Player>();
	}

Line 110:

[code=java]
@Override
public void run() {
try {

		address = new InetSocketAddress(host, port);
		System.out.println("Starting server on " + address + "...");
		
		PacketManager.loadPackets();
		
		ItemManager.getInstance().startup();

		// Load configuration.
		Equipment.sortEquipmentSlotDefinitions();
		
		// load all xstream related files.
		XStreamUtil.loadAllFiles();

		// Start up and get a'rollin!
		startup(); //<-- Line 110
		System.out.println("Online!");
		while (true) {
			cycle();
			sleep();
		}
	} catch (Exception ex) {
		ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [Azure] Start-up error
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I believe it’s throwing the error as it’s trying to bind the server to the dynamic address. Try binding it to the local InetAddress (localhost)

I’m trying to make it a public thing, so other people from other places can connect, not just me.

Read full topic

item.title: [Azure] Start-up error
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“NumberEleven, post:2, topic:399677”]I’ve had this. I believe its easily fixable by just changing the source

-NumberEleven

(rep++)[/quote]

Ehm. I’m not getting rid of Azure.
It’s stable and kind of blank. I’m sick of PI servers taking over RSPS. I think everyone should take their Project Insanity server and delete it.

Why did you post rep++? Did you want me to rep you for this or what? All you did was suggest getting a better source.
